text: <@U3A4KEWK1> I tried going after the same thing you wanted, but the usual method doesn't work: `{% menu "my_menu"  export_to_template_context=True, no_wrapper=True %}`
Yeah, the data in that doesn't actually contain the menu tree, just the menu's ID
And as far as I know there's no method for converting that ID into a list you can use
Would be a nice thing to have

I'm currently customizing a marketplace email template for a new client (<https://app.HubSpot.com/marketplace/2893111/products/HubSpot/riggs-newsletter-email>) and I've found a few hubl attributes I've never seen before in the documentation. Specifically, I was intrigued by these: ending_html="", starting_html="". They're attached to both image and text modules.

I tried putting some comments in there to see where they would populate to, but couldn't get anything to render in the resulting code. Anyone used these before? or are they left over from another system or something?
